trans-unit.source: Restrict email access to Exchange Online | Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Restrict email access to Exchange Online | Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: Protect and control access to company email on Exchange Online with conditional access.
trans-unit.target: Protect and control access to company email on Exchange Online with conditional access.

trans-unit.source: Restrict email access to Exchange Online and new Exchange Online Dedicated with Intune
trans-unit.target: Restrict email access to Exchange Online and new Exchange Online Dedicated with Intune

trans-unit.source: If you have an Exchange Online Dedicated environment and need to find out whether it is in the new or the legacy configuration, contact your account manager.
trans-unit.target: If you have an Exchange Online Dedicated environment and need to find out whether it is in the new or the legacy configuration, contact your account manager.

trans-unit.source: To control email access to Exchange Online or to your new Exchange Online Dedicated environment, configure conditional access for Exchange Online in Intune.
trans-unit.target: To control email access to Exchange Online or to your new Exchange Online Dedicated environment, configure conditional access for Exchange Online in Intune.

trans-unit.source: To learn more about how conditional access works, read the [restrict access to email, O365, and other services](restrict-access-to-email-and-o365-services-with-microsoft-intune.md) article.
trans-unit.target: To learn more about how conditional access works, read the [restrict access to email, O365, and other services](restrict-access-to-email-and-o365-services-with-microsoft-intune.md) article.

trans-unit.source: Conditional access for PCs and Windows 10 Mobile devices with apps using modern authentication is not currently available to all Intune customers.
trans-unit.target: Conditional access for PCs and Windows 10 Mobile devices with apps using modern authentication is not currently available to all Intune customers.

trans-unit.source: If you are already using these features, you do not need to take any action.
trans-unit.target: If you are already using these features, you do not need to take any action.

trans-unit.source: You can continue to use them.
trans-unit.target: You can continue to use them.

trans-unit.source: If you have not created conditional access policies for PCs or Windows 10 Mobile for apps using modern authentication, and would like to do so, sign up for the Azure Active Directory public preview which includes device based conditional access for Intune managed devices or domain joined Windows PCs.
trans-unit.target: If you have not created conditional access policies for PCs or Windows 10 Mobile for apps using modern authentication, and would like to do so, sign up for the Azure Active Directory public preview which includes device based conditional access for Intune managed devices or domain joined Windows PCs.

trans-unit.source: Read [this blog post](https://blogs.technet.microsoft.com/enterprisemobility/2016/08/10/azuread-conditional-access-policies-for-ios-android-and-windows-are-in-preview/) to learn more.
trans-unit.target: Read [this blog post](https://blogs.technet.microsoft.com/enterprisemobility/2016/08/10/azuread-conditional-access-policies-for-ios-android-and-windows-are-in-preview/) to learn more.

trans-unit.source: **Before** you can configure conditional access, you must:
trans-unit.target: **Before** you can configure conditional access, you must:

trans-unit.source: Have an **Office 365 subscription that includes Exchange Online (such as E3)** and users must be licensed for Exchange Online.
trans-unit.target: Have an **Office 365 subscription that includes Exchange Online (such as E3)** and users must be licensed for Exchange Online.

trans-unit.source: Consider configuring the optional **Microsoft Intune service-to-service connector**, which connects [!INCLUDE[wit_nextref](../includes/wit_nextref_md.md)] to Microsoft Exchange Online and helps you manage device information through the [!INCLUDE[wit_nextref](../includes/wit_nextref_md.md)] console.
trans-unit.target: Consider configuring the optional **Microsoft Intune service-to-service connector**, which connects [!INCLUDE[wit_nextref](../includes/wit_nextref_md.md)] to Microsoft Exchange Online and helps you manage device information through the [!INCLUDE[wit_nextref](../includes/wit_nextref_md.md)] console.

trans-unit.source: You do not need to use the connector to use compliance policies or conditional access policies, but it is required to run reports that help evaluate the impact of conditional access.
trans-unit.target: You do not need to use the connector to use compliance policies or conditional access policies, but it is required to run reports that help evaluate the impact of conditional access.

trans-unit.source: Do not configure the service- to-service connector if you intend to use conditional access for both Exchange Online and Exchange On-premises
trans-unit.target: Do not configure the service- to-service connector if you intend to use conditional access for both Exchange Online and Exchange On-premises

trans-unit.source: For instructions on how to configure the connector, see [Intune service-to-service connector](intune-service-to-service-exchange-connector.md)
trans-unit.target: For instructions on how to configure the connector, see [Intune service-to-service connector](intune-service-to-service-exchange-connector.md)

trans-unit.source: When conditional access policies are configured and targeted to a user, before a user can connect to their email, the **device** they use must be:
trans-unit.target: When conditional access policies are configured and targeted to a user, before a user can connect to their email, the **device** they use must be:

trans-unit.source: **Enrolled** with [!INCLUDE[wit_nextref](../includes/wit_nextref_md.md)] or is a domain joined PC.
trans-unit.target: **Enrolled** with [!INCLUDE[wit_nextref](../includes/wit_nextref_md.md)] or is a domain joined PC.

trans-unit.source: **Registered in Azure Active Directory**.
trans-unit.target: **Registered in Azure Active Directory**.

trans-unit.source: This happens automatically when the device is enrolled with [!INCLUDE[wit_nextref](../includes/wit_nextref_md.md)].
trans-unit.target: This happens automatically when the device is enrolled with [!INCLUDE[wit_nextref](../includes/wit_nextref_md.md)].

trans-unit.source: Additionally, the client Exchange ActiveSync ID must be registered with Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: Additionally, the client Exchange ActiveSync ID must be registered with Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: AAD DRS will be activated automatically for Intune and Office 365 customers.
trans-unit.target: AAD DRS will be activated automatically for Intune and Office 365 customers.

trans-unit.source: Customers who have already deployed the ADFS Device Registration Service will not see registered devices in their on-premises Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: Customers who have already deployed the ADFS Device Registration Service will not see registered devices in their on-premises Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: **Compliant** with any [!INCLUDE[wit_nextref](../includes/wit_nextref_md.md)] compliance policies deployed to that device, or domain joined to an on-premises domain.
trans-unit.target: **Compliant** with any [!INCLUDE[wit_nextref](../includes/wit_nextref_md.md)] compliance policies deployed to that device, or domain joined to an on-premises domain.

trans-unit.source: If a conditional access policy is not met, the user is presented with one of the following messages when they log in:
trans-unit.target: If a conditional access policy is not met, the user is presented with one of the following messages when they log in:

trans-unit.source: If the device is not enrolled with [!INCLUDE[wit_nextref](../includes/wit_nextref_md.md)], or is not registered in Azure Active Directory, a message is displayed with instructions about how to install the company portal app, enroll the device, and activate email.
trans-unit.target: If the device is not enrolled with [!INCLUDE[wit_nextref](../includes/wit_nextref_md.md)], or is not registered in Azure Active Directory, a message is displayed with instructions about how to install the company portal app, enroll the device, and activate email.

trans-unit.source: This process also associates the device’s Exchange ActiveSync ID with the record in Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: This process also associates the device’s Exchange ActiveSync ID with the record in Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: If the device is evaluated as not compliant with the compliance policy rules, the end user is directed to the [!INCLUDE[wit_nextref](../includes/wit_nextref_md.md)] Company Portal website, or the Company Portal app where they can find information about the problem and how to remediate it.
trans-unit.target: If the device is evaluated as not compliant with the compliance policy rules, the end user is directed to the [!INCLUDE[wit_nextref](../includes/wit_nextref_md.md)] Company Portal website, or the Company Portal app where they can find information about the problem and how to remediate it.

trans-unit.source: The diagram below illustrates the flow used by conditional access policies for Exchange Online.
trans-unit.target: The diagram below illustrates the flow used by conditional access policies for Exchange Online.

trans-unit.source: Diagram that illustrates the decisions points that determine if device is allowed access or blocked
trans-unit.target: Diagram that illustrates the decisions points that determine if device is allowed access or blocked

trans-unit.source: Support for mobile devices
trans-unit.target: Support for mobile devices

trans-unit.source: You can restrict access to Exchange Online email from **Outlook** and other **apps that use modern authentication**:-
trans-unit.target: You can restrict access to Exchange Online email from **Outlook** and other **apps that use modern authentication**:-

trans-unit.source: Android 4.0 and later, Samsung Knox Standard 4.0 and later
trans-unit.target: Android 4.0 and later, Samsung Knox Standard 4.0 and later

trans-unit.source: iOS 8.0 and later
trans-unit.target: iOS 8.0 and later

trans-unit.source: Windows Phone 8.1 and later
trans-unit.target: Windows Phone 8.1 and later

trans-unit.source: **Modern authentication** brings Active Directory Authentication Library (ADAL)-based sign in to Microsoft Office clients.
trans-unit.target: **Modern authentication** brings Active Directory Authentication Library (ADAL)-based sign in to Microsoft Office clients.

trans-unit.source: The ADAL based authentication enables Office clients to engage in browser-based authentication (also known as passive authentication).
trans-unit.target: The ADAL based authentication enables Office clients to engage in browser-based authentication (also known as passive authentication).

trans-unit.source: To authenticate, the user is directed to a sign-in web page.
trans-unit.target: To authenticate, the user is directed to a sign-in web page.

trans-unit.source: This new sign-in method enables better security like **multi-factor authentication**, and **certificate-based authentication**.
trans-unit.target: This new sign-in method enables better security like **multi-factor authentication**, and **certificate-based authentication**.

trans-unit.source: This [article](https://support.office.com/en-US/article/How-modern-authentication-works-for-Office-2013-and-Office-2016-client-apps-e4c45989-4b1a-462e-a81b-2a13191cf517) has more detailed information on how modern authentication works.
trans-unit.target: This [article](https://support.office.com/en-US/article/How-modern-authentication-works-for-Office-2013-and-Office-2016-client-apps-e4c45989-4b1a-462e-a81b-2a13191cf517) has more detailed information on how modern authentication works.

trans-unit.source: Setup ADFS claims rules to block non-modern authentication protocols.
trans-unit.target: Setup ADFS claims rules to block non-modern authentication protocols.

trans-unit.source: Detailed instructions are provided in scenario 3 - [block all access to O365 except browser based applications](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/dn592182.aspx).
trans-unit.target: Detailed instructions are provided in scenario 3 - [block all access to O365 except browser based applications](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/dn592182.aspx).

trans-unit.source: You can restrict access to **Outlook Web Access (OWA)** on Exchange Online when accessed from a browser on **iOS** and **Android** devices.
trans-unit.target: You can restrict access to **Outlook Web Access (OWA)** on Exchange Online when accessed from a browser on **iOS** and **Android** devices.

trans-unit.source: Access will only be allowed from only supported browsers on compliant devices:
trans-unit.target: Access will only be allowed from only supported browsers on compliant devices:

trans-unit.source: Safari (iOS)
trans-unit.target: Safari (iOS)

trans-unit.source: Chrome (Android)
trans-unit.target: Chrome (Android)

trans-unit.source: Managed Browser (iOS and Android)
trans-unit.target: Managed Browser (iOS and Android)

trans-unit.source: **Unsupported browsers will be blocked**.
trans-unit.target: **Unsupported browsers will be blocked**.

trans-unit.source: The OWA apps for iOS and Android are not supported.
trans-unit.target: The OWA apps for iOS and Android are not supported.

trans-unit.source: They should be blocked through ADFS claims rules.
trans-unit.target: They should be blocked through ADFS claims rules.

trans-unit.source: You can restrict access to Exchange email from the built-in **Exchange ActiveSync email client** on the following platforms:
trans-unit.target: You can restrict access to Exchange email from the built-in **Exchange ActiveSync email client** on the following platforms:

trans-unit.source: Android 4.0 and later, Samsung Knox Standard 4.0 and later
trans-unit.target: Android 4.0 and later, Samsung Knox Standard 4.0 and later

trans-unit.source: iOS 8.0 and later
trans-unit.target: iOS 8.0 and later

trans-unit.source: Windows Phone 8.1 and later
trans-unit.target: Windows Phone 8.1 and later

trans-unit.source: Support for PCs
trans-unit.target: Support for PCs

trans-unit.source: You can setup conditional access for PCs that run Office desktop applications to access **Exchange Online** and **SharePoint Online** for PCs that meet the following requirements:
trans-unit.target: You can setup conditional access for PCs that run Office desktop applications to access **Exchange Online** and **SharePoint Online** for PCs that meet the following requirements:

trans-unit.source: The PC must be running Windows 7.0 or Windows 8.1.
trans-unit.target: The PC must be running Windows 7.0 or Windows 8.1.

trans-unit.source: The PC must either be domain joined or compliant with the compliance policy rules.
trans-unit.target: The PC must either be domain joined or compliant with the compliance policy rules.

trans-unit.source: In order to be considered compliant, the PC must be enrolled in [!INCLUDE[wit_nextref](../includes/wit_nextref_md.md)] and comply with the policies.
trans-unit.target: In order to be considered compliant, the PC must be enrolled in [!INCLUDE[wit_nextref](../includes/wit_nextref_md.md)] and comply with the policies.

trans-unit.source: For domain joined PCs, you must set it up to [automatically register the device](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/active-directory-conditional-access-automatic-device-registration/) with Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: For domain joined PCs, you must set it up to [automatically register the device](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/active-directory-conditional-access-automatic-device-registration/) with Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: Conditional access is not supported on PCs running the Intune computer client.
trans-unit.target: Conditional access is not supported on PCs running the Intune computer client.

trans-unit.source: [Office 365 modern authentication must be enabled](https://support.office.com/en-US/article/Using-Office-365-modern-authentication-with-Office-clients-776c0036-66fd-41cb-8928-5495c0f9168a), and have all the latest Office updates.
trans-unit.target: [Office 365 modern authentication must be enabled](https://support.office.com/en-US/article/Using-Office-365-modern-authentication-with-Office-clients-776c0036-66fd-41cb-8928-5495c0f9168a), and have all the latest Office updates.

trans-unit.source: Modern authentication brings Active Directory Authentication Library (ADAL) based sign-in to Office 2013 Windows clients and enables better security like **multi-factor authentication**, and **certificate-based authentication**.
trans-unit.target: Modern authentication brings Active Directory Authentication Library (ADAL) based sign-in to Office 2013 Windows clients and enables better security like **multi-factor authentication**, and **certificate-based authentication**.

trans-unit.source: Set up ADFS claims rules to block non-modern authentication protocols.
trans-unit.target: Set up ADFS claims rules to block non-modern authentication protocols.

trans-unit.source: Detailed instructions are provided in scenario 3 - [block all access to O365 except browser based applications](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/dn592182.aspx).
trans-unit.target: Detailed instructions are provided in scenario 3 - [block all access to O365 except browser based applications](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/dn592182.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Configure conditional access
trans-unit.target: Configure conditional access

trans-unit.source: Step 1: Configure and deploy a compliance policy
trans-unit.target: Step 1: Configure and deploy a compliance policy

trans-unit.source: Make sure you [create](create-a-device-compliance-policy-in-microsoft-intune.md) and [deploy](deploy-and-monitor-a-device-compliance-policy-in-microsoft-intune.md) a compliance policy to the user groups who will also get the conditional access policy.
trans-unit.target: Make sure you [create](create-a-device-compliance-policy-in-microsoft-intune.md) and [deploy](deploy-and-monitor-a-device-compliance-policy-in-microsoft-intune.md) a compliance policy to the user groups who will also get the conditional access policy.

trans-unit.source: If you have not deployed a compliance policy, the devices will be considered compliant and will be allowed access to Exchange.
trans-unit.target: If you have not deployed a compliance policy, the devices will be considered compliant and will be allowed access to Exchange.

trans-unit.source: Step 2: Evaluate the effect of the conditional access policy
trans-unit.target: Step 2: Evaluate the effect of the conditional access policy

trans-unit.source: You can use the **Mobile Device Inventory Reports** to identify the devices that might be blocked from accessing Exchange after you configure the conditional access policy.
trans-unit.target: You can use the **Mobile Device Inventory Reports** to identify the devices that might be blocked from accessing Exchange after you configure the conditional access policy.

trans-unit.source: To do this, configure a connection between [!INCLUDE[wit_nextref](../includes/wit_nextref_md.md)] and Exchange by using the [Microsoft Intune service-to-service connector](intune-service-to-service-exchange-connector.md).
trans-unit.target: To do this, configure a connection between [!INCLUDE[wit_nextref](../includes/wit_nextref_md.md)] and Exchange by using the [Microsoft Intune service-to-service connector](intune-service-to-service-exchange-connector.md).

trans-unit.source: Navigate to **Reports -> Mobile Device Inventory Reports**.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to **Reports -> Mobile Device Inventory Reports**.

trans-unit.source: ![Screenshot of the Mobile device inventory report page](../media/IntuneSA2bMobileDeviceInventoryReport.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Screenshot of the Mobile device inventory report page](../media/IntuneSA2bMobileDeviceInventoryReport.png)

trans-unit.source: In the report parameters, select the [!INCLUDE[wit_nextref](../includes/wit_nextref_md.md)] group you want to evaluate and, if required, the device platforms to which the policy will apply.
trans-unit.target: In the report parameters, select the [!INCLUDE[wit_nextref](../includes/wit_nextref_md.md)] group you want to evaluate and, if required, the device platforms to which the policy will apply.

trans-unit.source: Once you’ve selected the criteria that meets your organization’s needs, choose **View Report**.
trans-unit.target: Once you’ve selected the criteria that meets your organization’s needs, choose **View Report**.

trans-unit.source: The Report Viewer opens in a new window.
trans-unit.target: The Report Viewer opens in a new window.

trans-unit.source: ![Screenshot of an sample mobile device inventory report](../media/IntuneSA2cViewReport.PNG)
trans-unit.target: ![Screenshot of an sample mobile device inventory report](../media/IntuneSA2cViewReport.PNG)

trans-unit.source: After you run the report, examine these four columns to determine whether a user will be blocked:
trans-unit.target: After you run the report, examine these four columns to determine whether a user will be blocked:

trans-unit.source: **Management Channel** – Indicates whether the device is managed by Intune, Exchange ActiveSync, or both.
trans-unit.target: **Management Channel** – Indicates whether the device is managed by Intune, Exchange ActiveSync, or both.

trans-unit.source: **AAD Registered** – Indicates whether the device is registered with Azure Active Directory (known as Workplace Join).
trans-unit.target: **AAD Registered** – Indicates whether the device is registered with Azure Active Directory (known as Workplace Join).

trans-unit.source: **Compliant** – Indicates whether the device is compliant with any compliance policies you deployed.
trans-unit.target: **Compliant** – Indicates whether the device is compliant with any compliance policies you deployed.

trans-unit.source: **Exchange ActiveSync ID** – iOS and Android devices are required to have their Exchange ActiveSync ID associated with the device registration record in Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: **Exchange ActiveSync ID** – iOS and Android devices are required to have their Exchange ActiveSync ID associated with the device registration record in Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: This happens when the user chooses the **Activate Email** link in the quarantine email.
trans-unit.target: This happens when the user chooses the **Activate Email** link in the quarantine email.

trans-unit.source: Windows Phone devices always display a value in this column.
trans-unit.target: Windows Phone devices always display a value in this column.

trans-unit.source: Devices that are part of a targeted group will be blocked from accessing Exchange unless the column values match those listed in the following table:
trans-unit.target: Devices that are part of a targeted group will be blocked from accessing Exchange unless the column values match those listed in the following table:

trans-unit.source: Management channel
trans-unit.target: Management channel

trans-unit.source: AAD registered
trans-unit.target: AAD registered

trans-unit.source: Compliant
trans-unit.target: Compliant

trans-unit.source: Exchange ActiveSync ID
trans-unit.target: Exchange ActiveSync ID

trans-unit.source: Resulting action
trans-unit.target: Resulting action

trans-unit.source: **Managed by Microsoft Intune and Exchange ActiveSync**
trans-unit.target: **Managed by Microsoft Intune and Exchange ActiveSync**

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: A value is displayed
trans-unit.target: A value is displayed

trans-unit.source: Email access allowed
trans-unit.target: Email access allowed

trans-unit.source: Any other value
trans-unit.target: Any other value

trans-unit.source: No
trans-unit.target: No

trans-unit.source: No
trans-unit.target: No

trans-unit.source: No value is displayed
trans-unit.target: No value is displayed

trans-unit.source: Email access blocked
trans-unit.target: Email access blocked

trans-unit.source: You can export the contents of the report and use the **Email Address** column to tell your users that they will be blocked.
trans-unit.target: You can export the contents of the report and use the **Email Address** column to tell your users that they will be blocked.

trans-unit.source: Step 3: Configure user groups for the conditional access policy
trans-unit.target: Step 3: Configure user groups for the conditional access policy

trans-unit.source: Conditional access policies are targeted to different Azure Active Directory security groups of users.
trans-unit.target: Conditional access policies are targeted to different Azure Active Directory security groups of users.

trans-unit.source: You can also exempt certain user groups from this policy.
trans-unit.target: You can also exempt certain user groups from this policy.

trans-unit.source: When a user is targeted by a policy, each device they use must be compliant in order to access email.
trans-unit.target: When a user is targeted by a policy, each device they use must be compliant in order to access email.

trans-unit.source: You can configure these groups in the **Office 365 admin center**, or the **Intune account portal**.
trans-unit.target: You can configure these groups in the **Office 365 admin center**, or the **Intune account portal**.

trans-unit.source: You can specify two group types in each policy:
trans-unit.target: You can specify two group types in each policy:

trans-unit.source: **Targeted groups** – User groups to which the policy is applied.
trans-unit.target: **Targeted groups** – User groups to which the policy is applied.

trans-unit.source: **Exempted groups** – User groups that are exempt from the policy (optional)
trans-unit.target: **Exempted groups** – User groups that are exempt from the policy (optional)

trans-unit.source: If a user is in both groups, they will be exempt from the policy.
trans-unit.target: If a user is in both groups, they will be exempt from the policy.

trans-unit.source: Only the groups which are targeted by the conditional access policy are evaluated.
trans-unit.target: Only the groups which are targeted by the conditional access policy are evaluated.

trans-unit.source: Step 4: Configure the conditional access policy
trans-unit.target: Step 4: Configure the conditional access policy

trans-unit.source: In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](https://manage.microsoft.com), choose **Policy** > **Conditional Access** > **Exchange Online Policy**.
trans-unit.target: In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](https://manage.microsoft.com), choose **Policy** > **Conditional Access** > **Exchange Online Policy**.

trans-unit.source: ![Screenshot of the Exchange Online conditional access policy page](../media/mdm-ca-exo-policy-configuration.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Screenshot of the Exchange Online conditional access policy page](../media/mdm-ca-exo-policy-configuration.png)

trans-unit.source: On the **Exchange Online Policy** page, select **Enable conditional access policy for Exchange Online**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Exchange Online Policy** page, select **Enable conditional access policy for Exchange Online**.

trans-unit.source: If you have not deployed a compliance policy, devices are treated as compliant.
trans-unit.target: If you have not deployed a compliance policy, devices are treated as compliant.

trans-unit.source: Regardless of the compliance state, all users who are targeted by the policy will be required to enroll their devices with [!INCLUDE[wit_nextref](../includes/wit_nextref_md.md)].
trans-unit.target: Regardless of the compliance state, all users who are targeted by the policy will be required to enroll their devices with [!INCLUDE[wit_nextref](../includes/wit_nextref_md.md)].

trans-unit.source: Under **Application access**, for apps that use modern authentication, you have two ways of choosing which platforms the policy should apply.
trans-unit.target: Under **Application access**, for apps that use modern authentication, you have two ways of choosing which platforms the policy should apply.

trans-unit.source: Supported platforms include Android, iOS, Windows, and Windows Phone.
trans-unit.target: Supported platforms include Android, iOS, Windows, and Windows Phone.

trans-unit.source: **All platforms**
trans-unit.target: **All platforms**

trans-unit.source: This will require that any device used to access **Exchange Online**, to be enrolled in Intune and compliant with the policies.
trans-unit.target: This will require that any device used to access **Exchange Online**, to be enrolled in Intune and compliant with the policies.

trans-unit.source: Any client application using **modern authentication** is subject to the conditional access policy, and if the platform is currently not supported by Intune, access to **Exchange Online** is blocked.
trans-unit.target: Any client application using **modern authentication** is subject to the conditional access policy, and if the platform is currently not supported by Intune, access to **Exchange Online** is blocked.

trans-unit.source: Selecting the **All platforms** option means that Azure Active Directory will apply this policy to all authentication requests, regardless of the platform reported by the client application.
trans-unit.target: Selecting the **All platforms** option means that Azure Active Directory will apply this policy to all authentication requests, regardless of the platform reported by the client application.

trans-unit.source: All platforms will be required to enrolled and become compliant, except for:
trans-unit.target: All platforms will be required to enrolled and become compliant, except for:

trans-unit.source: Windows devices will be required to be enrolled and compliant, domain joined with on-premises Active Directory, or both
trans-unit.target: Windows devices will be required to be enrolled and compliant, domain joined with on-premises Active Directory, or both

trans-unit.source: Unsupported platforms like Mac OS.
trans-unit.target: Unsupported platforms like Mac OS.

trans-unit.source: However, apps using modern authentication coming from these platforms will be still be blocked.
trans-unit.target: However, apps using modern authentication coming from these platforms will be still be blocked.

trans-unit.source: You may not see this option if you not already using conditional access for PCs.
trans-unit.target: You may not see this option if you not already using conditional access for PCs.

trans-unit.source: Use the **Specific platforms** instead.
trans-unit.target: Use the **Specific platforms** instead.

trans-unit.source: Conditional access for PCs is not currently available to all Intune customers.
trans-unit.target: Conditional access for PCs is not currently available to all Intune customers.

trans-unit.source: You can find out more information about how to get access to this feature [in this blog post ](https://blogs.technet.microsoft.com/enterprisemobility/2016/08/10/azuread-conditional-access-policies-for-ios-android-and-windows-are-in-preview/).
trans-unit.target: You can find out more information about how to get access to this feature [in this blog post ](https://blogs.technet.microsoft.com/enterprisemobility/2016/08/10/azuread-conditional-access-policies-for-ios-android-and-windows-are-in-preview/).

trans-unit.source: **Specific platforms**
trans-unit.target: **Specific platforms**

trans-unit.source: Conditional access policy will apply to any client app that is using **modern authentication** on the device platforms you specify.
trans-unit.target: Conditional access policy will apply to any client app that is using **modern authentication** on the device platforms you specify.

trans-unit.source: Under **Outlook web access (OWA)**, you can choose to allow access to Exchange Online only through the supported browsers: Safari (iOS), and Chrome (Android).
trans-unit.target: Under **Outlook web access (OWA)**, you can choose to allow access to Exchange Online only through the supported browsers: Safari (iOS), and Chrome (Android).

trans-unit.source: Access from other browsers will be blocked.
trans-unit.target: Access from other browsers will be blocked.

trans-unit.source: The same platform restrictions you selected for Application access for Outlook also apply here.
trans-unit.target: The same platform restrictions you selected for Application access for Outlook also apply here.

trans-unit.source: On **Android** devices, users must enable the browser access.
trans-unit.target: On **Android** devices, users must enable the browser access.

trans-unit.source: To do this the end-user must enable the “Enable Browser Access” option on the enrolled device as follows:
trans-unit.target: To do this the end-user must enable the “Enable Browser Access” option on the enrolled device as follows:

trans-unit.source: Launch the **Company Portal app**.
trans-unit.target: Launch the **Company Portal app**.

trans-unit.source: Go to the **Settings** page from the triple dots (…) or the hardware menu button.
trans-unit.target: Go to the **Settings** page from the triple dots (…) or the hardware menu button.

trans-unit.source: Press the **Enable Browser Access** button.
trans-unit.target: Press the **Enable Browser Access** button.

trans-unit.source: In the Chrome browser, sign out of Office 365 and restart Chrome.
trans-unit.target: In the Chrome browser, sign out of Office 365 and restart Chrome.

trans-unit.source: On **iOS and Android** platforms, To identify the device that is used to access the service, Azure Active Directory will issue a Transport layer security ( TLS) certificate to the device.
trans-unit.target: On **iOS and Android** platforms, To identify the device that is used to access the service, Azure Active Directory will issue a Transport layer security ( TLS) certificate to the device.

trans-unit.source: The device displays the certificate with a prompt to the end-user to select the certificate as seen in the screenshots below.
trans-unit.target: The device displays the certificate with a prompt to the end-user to select the certificate as seen in the screenshots below.

trans-unit.source: The end-user must select this certificate before they can continue to use the browser.
trans-unit.target: The end-user must select this certificate before they can continue to use the browser.

trans-unit.source: **iOS**
trans-unit.target: **iOS**

trans-unit.source: screenshot of the certificate prompt on an ipad
trans-unit.target: screenshot of the certificate prompt on an ipad

trans-unit.source: **Android**
trans-unit.target: **Android**

trans-unit.source: screenshot of the certificate prompt on an Android device
trans-unit.target: screenshot of the certificate prompt on an Android device

trans-unit.source: Under **Exchange ActiveSync apps**, you can choose to block noncompliant devices from accessing Exchange Online.
trans-unit.target: Under **Exchange ActiveSync apps**, you can choose to block noncompliant devices from accessing Exchange Online.

trans-unit.source: You can also select whether to allow or block access to email when the device is not running a supported platform.
trans-unit.target: You can also select whether to allow or block access to email when the device is not running a supported platform.

trans-unit.source: Supported platforms include Android, iOS, Windows, and Windows Phone.
trans-unit.target: Supported platforms include Android, iOS, Windows, and Windows Phone.

trans-unit.source: Under **Targeted Groups**, select the Active Directory security groups of users to which the policy will apply.
trans-unit.target: Under **Targeted Groups**, select the Active Directory security groups of users to which the policy will apply.

trans-unit.source: You can either choose to target all users or a selected list of user groups.
trans-unit.target: You can either choose to target all users or a selected list of user groups.

trans-unit.source: ![Screenshot of the Exchange Online conditional access policy page showing the Targeted and Exempted group options](../media/IntuneSA5eTargetedExemptedGroups.PNG)
trans-unit.target: ![Screenshot of the Exchange Online conditional access policy page showing the Targeted and Exempted group options](../media/IntuneSA5eTargetedExemptedGroups.PNG)

trans-unit.source: For users that are in the **Targeted groups**, the Intune polices will replace Exchange rules and policies.
trans-unit.target: For users that are in the **Targeted groups**, the Intune polices will replace Exchange rules and policies.

trans-unit.source: Exchange will only enforce the Exchange allow, block and quarantine rules, and Exchange policies if:
trans-unit.target: Exchange will only enforce the Exchange allow, block and quarantine rules, and Exchange policies if:

trans-unit.source: The user is not licensed for Intune.
trans-unit.target: The user is not licensed for Intune.

trans-unit.source: The user is licensed for Intune, but the user does not belong to any security groups targeted in the conditional access policy.
trans-unit.target: The user is licensed for Intune, but the user does not belong to any security groups targeted in the conditional access policy.

trans-unit.source: Under **Exempted Groups**, select the Active Directory security groups of users that are exempt from this policy.
trans-unit.target: Under **Exempted Groups**, select the Active Directory security groups of users that are exempt from this policy.

trans-unit.source: If a user is in both the targeted and exempted groups, they will be exempt from the policy.
trans-unit.target: If a user is in both the targeted and exempted groups, they will be exempt from the policy.

trans-unit.source: When you are done, choose **Save**.
trans-unit.target: When you are done, choose **Save**.

trans-unit.source: You do not have to deploy the conditional access policy, it takes effect immediately.
trans-unit.target: You do not have to deploy the conditional access policy, it takes effect immediately.

trans-unit.source: After a user creates an email account, the device is blocked immediately.
trans-unit.target: After a user creates an email account, the device is blocked immediately.

trans-unit.source: If a blocked user enrolls the device with [!INCLUDE[wit_nextref](../includes/wit_nextref_md.md)] and fixes any noncompliance issues, email access is unblocked within 2 minutes.
trans-unit.target: If a blocked user enrolls the device with [!INCLUDE[wit_nextref](../includes/wit_nextref_md.md)] and fixes any noncompliance issues, email access is unblocked within 2 minutes.

trans-unit.source: If the user un-enrolls their device, email is blocked after around 6 hours.
trans-unit.target: If the user un-enrolls their device, email is blocked after around 6 hours.

trans-unit.source: **To see some example scenarios of how you would configure conditional access policy to restrict device access, see [restrict email access example scenarios](restrict-email-access-example-scenarios.md).**
trans-unit.target: **To see some example scenarios of how you would configure conditional access policy to restrict device access, see [restrict email access example scenarios](restrict-email-access-example-scenarios.md).**

trans-unit.source: Monitor the compliance and conditional access policies
trans-unit.target: Monitor the compliance and conditional access policies

trans-unit.source: To view devices that are blocked from Exchange
trans-unit.target: To view devices that are blocked from Exchange

trans-unit.source: On the [!INCLUDE[wit_nextref](../includes/wit_nextref_md.md)] dashboard, choose the **Blocked Devices from Exchange** tile to show the number of blocked devices and links to more information.
trans-unit.target: On the [!INCLUDE[wit_nextref](../includes/wit_nextref_md.md)] dashboard, choose the **Blocked Devices from Exchange** tile to show the number of blocked devices and links to more information.

trans-unit.source: ![Screenshot of the Intune dashboard showing the number of devices that are blocked from accessing Exchange](../media/IntuneSA6BlockedDevices.PNG)
trans-unit.target: ![Screenshot of the Intune dashboard showing the number of devices that are blocked from accessing Exchange](../media/IntuneSA6BlockedDevices.PNG)
